summary: The AI Warnings And Resources for Education Act (AWARE Act) directs the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to create educational resources for parents, educators, and minors regarding the safe and responsible use of AI chatbots. These resources, to be developed within 180 days of the Act's enactment, will cover topics like identifying safe and unsafe AI chatbot use, privacy implications, and best practices for parental supervision. The FTC is instructed to model these resources on its existing Youville program. The bill defines key terms like "artificial intelligence," "AI chatbot," "Commission," "minor," and "parent."
